p: Thorp and Dierig (2011) provided a good example of the application of this methodology achieving much better correlation for Lesquerella fendleri ( Brassicaceae). However, L. fendleri is an herb/forb which may produce all the flowers at approximately the same level; additionally, their experiment was conducted in highly controlled conditions with only one unique area of 1 m 2 being observed through time, which was not the case in our variable field conditions.
